text: The actinide series is the 15 chemical elements between actinium and lawrencium on the periodic table. They have the atomic numbers between 89 and 103. The actinide series is named after actinium. All of the elements are radioactive. Uranium is the most common natural actinide, and thorium second. The term ‘actinide series’ has been derived from the first element of the series, actinium. The symbol An is used while referring to any of the actinide series elements. All actinide series elements are radioactive in nature, they release a large amount of energy on radioactive decay. Uranium and thorium are the most abundant naturally occurring actinides on earth, whereas plutonium is synthetically obtained. == The actinide elements == Atomic Number Name Symbol Picture 89 Actinium Ac − 90 Thorium Th 91 Protactinium Pa − 92 Uranium U 93 Neptunium Np 94 Plutonium Pu 95 Americium Am 96 Curium Cm − 97 Berkelium Bk 98 Californium Cf 99 Einsteinium Es 100 Fermium Fm − 101 Mendelevium Md − 102 Nobelium No − 103 Lawrencium Lr − == References ==
title: Actinide
